intro: Parosela schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's parosela, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
